00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.aed2xyz
00003  * External for Jamoma: conversion between SpatDIF-compliant xyz and aed coordinate systems
00004  * By Trond Lossius, © 2007
00005  * Based on code © 2006 Jan Schacher / ICST Zurich
00006  *

00009  *
00010  * History:
00011  *
00012  * 20071021: jcom.aed2xyz: ICST code ported and adopted to Jamoma
00013  * 20070905: icst.3Dcartopol.c released: Based on code from ICST ambisonics modules
00014  */ 
00015 
00016 #include "jamoma.h"
00017 
00018 const double rad2deg = 180.0 / 3.141592653589793238462643383279502884197169399375105820974944592307816406286208998628034825342117068;
00019 const double deg2rad = 3.141592653589793238462643383279502884197169399375105820974944592307816406286208998628034825342117068 / 180.0;
00020 
00021 typedef struct x                                        // Data structure for this object 
00022 {
00023         Object          ob;                                     // Must always be the first field; used by Max
00024         void            *obex;                          // Pointer to object extensions (for attributes)
00025         void            *outlet;                        // Pointer to outlet. need one for each outlet 
00026         Atom            outlist[3];                     // used for sending lists out   
00027 }t_aed2xyz;
00028 
00029 
00030 
00031 // Class Globals
00032 t_class         *this_class;                            // Required. Global pointing to this class
00033 
00034 
00035 // Prototypes for methods: need a method for each incoming message
00036 void *aed2xyz_new(void);                                                                        // object creation method  
00037 void aed2xyz_bang(t_aed2xyz *x);                                                        // method for "bang" message 
00038 void aed2xyz_assist(t_aed2xyz *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);    // assistance messages
00039 void aed2xyz_list(t_aed2xyz *x, Symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);  // method for "list" message
00040 
00041         
00042 /*********************************************************/
00043 //Main() Function
00044 
00045 int main(void)                  //main receives a copy of the Max function macros table 
00046 {
00047         t_class *c;
00048         
00049         jamoma_init();
00050 
00051         // Define our class
00052         c = class_new("jcom.aed2xyz",(method)aed2xyz_new, (method)0L, (short)sizeof(t_aed2xyz), (method)0L, 0, 0);
00053         class_obexoffset_set(c,calcoffset(t_aed2xyz, obex));
00054         
00055         // Make methods available for our class:
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)aed2xyz_bang,                        "bang",         0L);    
00057     class_addmethod(c, (method)aed2xyz_list,                    "list",         A_GIMME, 0L);
00058     class_addmethod(c, (method)aed2xyz_assist,                  "assist",       A_CANT, 0L); 
00059     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout",      A_CANT,0);      
00060     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref", A_CANT, 0);
00061 
00062         // Finalize our class
00063         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00064         this_class = c;
00065         return 0;
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 /*********************************************************/
00070 //Object Creation Function
00071 
00072 void *aed2xyz_new(void)
00073 {
00074         t_aed2xyz       *x;                                                             // Declare an object (based on our struct)
00075 
00076         x = (t_aed2xyz *)object_alloc(this_class);      // Create object, store pointer to it (get 1 inlet free)
00077         if (x) {
00078                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x,NULL));       // dumpout
00079                 x->outlet = outlet_new(x, 0);                   // Create the outlet    
00080                 
00081                 // Initialize           
00082                 atom_setfloat(&x->outlist[0], 0.);
00083                 atom_setfloat(&x->outlist[1], 0.);
00084                 atom_setfloat(&x->outlist[2], 0.);
00085         }       
00086         return(x);                                                                      // Must return a pointer to the new instance 
00087 }
00088 
00089 
00090 /*********************************************************/
00091 //Bound to inlet Functions
00092 
00093 // Method for Assistance Messages
00094 void aed2xyz_assist(t_aed2xyz *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00095 {
00096         if(msg==1){     // Inlets
00097                 switch(arg){
00098                         case 0: strcpy(dst, "(list) aed"); break;
00099                 }
00100         }
00101         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00102                 switch(arg){
00103                         case 0: strcpy(dst, "(list) xyz"); break;
00104                 }       
00105         }       
00106 }
00107 
00108 
00109 // LIST INPUT - calculate and output
00110 void aed2xyz_list(t_aed2xyz *x, Symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00111 {
00112         double a, e, d;
00113         
00114         if (argc=3) {
00115                 a = (90. - atom_getfloat(argv)) * deg2rad;
00116                 e = (atom_getfloat(argv+1) * deg2rad);
00117                 d = atom_getfloat(argv+2);
00118         
00119                 atom_setfloat(&x->outlist[0], cos(a) * cos(e) * d);
00120                 atom_setfloat(&x->outlist[1], sin(a) * cos(e) * d);
00121                 atom_setfloat(&x->outlist[2], sin(e) * d);
00122                 
00123                 aed2xyz_bang(x);
00124         }
00125         else
00126                 error("jcom.aed2xyz: Invalid list content.");
00127 }
00128 
00129 
00130 // BANG - output
00131 void aed2xyz_bang(t_aed2xyz *x)
00132 {
00133                 outlet_anything(x->outlet, _sym_list, 3, x->outlist);   // output the result
00134 }
